intro: Seseli gilliesii, commonly known as the Gillies' seseli, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, such as meadows and slopes. It is known for its aromatic foliage and is often found in areas with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
